theories.name: Virtual/Augmented Reality in Education
theories.description: Virtual and Augmented Reality in Education leverages immersive technologies to create engaging, experiential learning environments. VR provides fully immersive simulated environments, while AR overlays digital information onto the physical world. These technologies enable experiential learning, visualization of abstract concepts, safe practice of dangerous procedures, and virtual field trips impossible in traditional settings.
theories.description_ja: 教育におけるVR/ARは、没入型技術を活用して魅力的な体験学習環境を創出します。VRは完全に没入型のシミュレーション環境を提供し、ARはデジタル情報を物理的世界に重ね合わせます。これらの技術は体験学習、抽象概念の可視化、危険な手順の安全な練習、従来の環境では不可能な仮想フィールドトリップを可能にします。
key_principles: Visualization of abstract and complex concepts

theories.name: Constructionism
theories.name_ja: コンストラクショニズム
theories.description: Constructionism, developed by Seymour Papert, extends constructivism by emphasizing learning through making tangible artifacts. Learners construct knowledge most effectively when they create personally meaningful external products that can be shared with others. The theory originated from work with LOGO programming and has influenced maker education, computational thinking, and creative learning technologies.
theories.description_ja: コンストラクショニズムは、シーモア・パパートによって発展され、具体的な成果物の作成を通じた学習を強調して構成主義を拡張します。学習者は他者と共有できる個人的に意味のある外部の産物を作成する時に最も効果的に知識を構築します。この理論はLOGOプログラミングの研究から生まれ、メイカー教育、計算論的思考、創造的学習技術に影響を与えています。
key_principles: Learning by making: creating tangible artifacts
Low floors, high ceilings, wide walls design
Technology as construction material for ideas
applications: Maker spaces and fab labs in schools
limitations: Assessment of process learning is challenging

theories.name: Community of Inquiry
theories.description: The Community of Inquiry (CoI) framework describes the elements required for a successful educational experience in online and blended learning environments. It identifies three interdependent presences: Social Presence (ability to project oneself), Cognitive Presence (critical thinking and discourse), and Teaching Presence (design and facilitation). The intersection of these creates meaningful learning experiences.
theories.description_ja: 探究コミュニティ（CoI）フレームワークは、オンラインおよびブレンド学習環境で成功する教育体験に必要な要素を記述します。三つの相互依存するプレゼンスを特定します：ソーシャルプレゼンス（自己を投影する能力）、認知的プレゼンス（批判的思考と対話）、教授プレゼンス（設計と促進）。これらの交差が意味のある学習体験を創出します。
key_principles: Social Presence: emotional expression and group cohesion
Teaching Presence: design, facilitation, direct instruction
Integration of three presences for deep learning
Practical inquiry model for knowledge construction

theories.name: Deep Learning (in Education)
theories.name_ja: ディープラーニング（教育）
theories.description: Deep Learning in Education refers to developing competencies that prepare students for an uncertain future through engaging, relevant learning experiences. It emphasizes the '6Cs': Character, Citizenship, Collaboration, Communication, Creativity, and Critical Thinking. Deep learning moves beyond surface knowledge acquisition to develop transferable skills and genuine understanding.
theories.description_ja: 教育におけるディープラーニングは、魅力的で関連性のある学習体験を通じて、不確実な未来に向けて生徒を準備するコンピテンシーの発達を指します。6つのC（品性、市民性、協働、コミュニケーション、創造性、批判的思考）を強調します。表面的な知識の獲得を超えて、転移可能なスキルと真の理解を発達させます。
key_principles: 6Cs: Character, Citizenship, Collaboration, Communication, Creativity, Critical Thinking
applications: New Pedagogies for Deep Learning global initiative
limitations: Assessment of deep competencies is complex

theories.name: Competency-Based Education
theories.name_ja: コンピテンシー基盤型教育
theories.description: Competency-Based Education (CBE) structures learning around the mastery of specific, clearly defined competencies rather than time spent in class. Students progress upon demonstrating mastery regardless of how long it takes. CBE emphasizes transparent learning outcomes, flexible pacing, and performance-based assessment, making education more personalized and outcome-focused.
theories.description_ja: コンピテンシー基盤型教育（CBE）は、授業時間ではなく、明確に定義された特定のコンピテンシーの習得を中心に学習を構造化します。学生は所要時間に関係なく習得を実証することで進級します。CBEは透明な学習成果、柔軟なペース配分、パフォーマンス基盤の評価を強調し、教育をより個別化し成果重視にします。
limitations: May not fit all content areas

theories.name: Maker Education
theories.description: Maker Education emphasizes learning through hands-on creation, tinkering, and building physical or digital artifacts. Rooted in constructionism, it leverages maker spaces, digital fabrication tools, and a culture of sharing. Students develop agency, creativity, and STEM skills through authentic making projects that connect to personal interests and real-world problems.
theories.description_ja: メイカー教育は、実践的な創作、試行錯誤、物理的またはデジタルな成果物の構築を通じた学習を強調します。コンストラクショニズムに根ざし、メイカースペース、デジタルファブリケーションツール、共有の文化を活用します。学生は個人の興味と実世界の問題に結びついた本格的な製作プロジェクトを通じて、主体性、創造性、STEMスキルを発達させます。
key_principles: Iteration and tinkering as learning processes
Student agency and choice in projects
Integration of traditional and digital fabrication
applications: School maker spaces and fab labs

theories.name: Design Thinking in Education
theories.name_ja: 教育におけるデザイン思考
theories.description: Design Thinking in Education applies human-centered design processes to teaching, learning, and educational problem-solving. The iterative process includes empathize, define, ideate, prototype, and test phases. Students develop creative confidence, empathy, and innovative problem-solving skills while teachers use design thinking to create more engaging and effective learning experiences.
theories.description_ja: 教育におけるデザイン思考は、人間中心のデザインプロセスを教授、学習、教育的問題解決に適用します。反復的なプロセスには共感、定義、アイデア創出、プロトタイプ、テストの段階が含まれます。学生は創造的自信、共感力、革新的な問題解決スキルを発達させ、教師はより魅力的で効果的な学習体験を創出するためにデザイン思考を使用します。
key_principles: Five stages: Empathize, Define, Ideate, Prototype, Test
limitations: May not suit all problem types

theories.name: Microlearning
theories.description: Microlearning delivers educational content in small, focused bursts typically lasting 3-10 minutes. It addresses the forgetting curve through spaced repetition and leverages mobile technology for just-in-time learning. Microlearning is particularly effective for skill reinforcement, performance support, and busy learners who need flexible, bite-sized learning opportunities.
theories.description_ja: マイクロラーニングは、通常3〜10分程度の小さく焦点を絞った単位で教育コンテンツを提供します。間隔反復を通じて忘却曲線に対処し、モバイル技術を活用してジャストインタイム学習を実現します。マイクロラーニングは、スキル強化、パフォーマンスサポート、柔軟で一口サイズの学習機会を必要とする多忙な学習者に特に効果的です。

theories.name: Self-Regulated Learning
theories.description: Self-Regulated Learning (SRL) describes how learners actively manage their own learning processes through metacognitive, motivational, and behavioral strategies. The cyclical model includes forethought (planning), performance (execution and monitoring), and self-reflection (evaluation). Effective self-regulated learners set goals, monitor progress, and adjust strategies based on feedback.
theories.description_ja: 自己調整学習（SRL）は、学習者がメタ認知的、動機づけ的、行動的な戦略を通じて自らの学習プロセスを能動的に管理する方法を記述します。循環モデルには予見（計画）、遂行（実行と監視）、自己省察（評価）が含まれます。効果的な自己調整学習者は目標を設定し、進捗を監視し、フィードバックに基づいて戦略を調整します。
limitations: Development varies by age and context
Time needed to develop SRL skills

theories.name: Critical Literacy
theories.description: Critical Literacy is an approach to reading and writing that goes beyond surface comprehension to examine how texts construct power, identity, and social relations. Rooted in critical pedagogy, it encourages learners to question dominant narratives, recognize bias, and understand how language shapes reality. Students learn to read the word and the world simultaneously.
theories.description_ja: 批判的リテラシーは、表面的な理解を超えて、テキストがいかに権力、アイデンティティ、社会関係を構築するかを検討する読み書きへのアプローチです。批判的教育学に根ざし、学習者に支配的な物語に疑問を呈し、偏見を認識し、言語がいかに現実を形作るかを理解することを奨励します。学生は言葉と世界を同時に読むことを学びます。
key_principles: Texts are never neutral; they reflect perspectives
Reading involves questioning author purpose and bias
Language constructs and reflects power relations
Literacy for social justice and transformation
Examining whose voices are present and absent
limitations: Can be challenging for young learners

theories.name: Feminist Pedagogy
theories.description: Feminist Pedagogy challenges traditional hierarchical classroom structures and examines how gender and power shape educational experiences. It emphasizes collaborative learning, personal experience as valid knowledge, and the transformation of teacher-student relationships. The approach seeks to create inclusive spaces where diverse voices are valued and patriarchal assumptions are questioned.
theories.description_ja: フェミニスト教育学は、伝統的な階層的教室構造に挑戦し、ジェンダーと権力がいかに教育体験を形作るかを検討します。協働学習、有効な知識としての個人的経験、教師-学生関係の変革を強調します。このアプローチは、多様な声が尊重され、家父長制的な前提が問われる包括的な空間を創出することを目指します。
key_principles: Personal experience as valid knowledge source
Voice and empowerment for marginalized groups
Integration of emotion and reason in learning
limitations: Challenging to implement in traditional settings

theories.name: Anti-Racist Education
theories.description: Anti-Racist Education actively confronts and dismantles racism in educational settings through curriculum, pedagogy, and institutional practices. It moves beyond multicultural education to examine systemic racism, white privilege, and the need for active anti-racist action. The approach emphasizes that racism must be actively opposed, not just passively tolerated.
theories.description_ja: 反人種差別教育は、カリキュラム、教育学、制度的実践を通じて教育環境における人種差別に積極的に立ち向かい、解体します。多文化教育を超えて、システム的な人種差別、白人の特権、積極的な反人種差別行動の必要性を検討します。このアプローチは、人種差別は受動的に容認されるのではなく、積極的に反対されなければならないことを強調します。
key_principles: Racism is systemic, not just individual prejudice
Examination of white privilege and power
strengths: Addresses root causes of educational inequity
limitations: Risk of performative rather than substantive change

theories.name: Culturally Sustaining Pedagogy
theories.description: Culturally Sustaining Pedagogy (CSP) extends culturally relevant pedagogy by actively sustaining and revitalizing students' cultural practices and languages. Rather than simply making connections to students' cultures, CSP positions these cultures as assets to be maintained across generations. It supports linguistic, literate, and cultural pluralism as a societal goal.
theories.description_ja: 文化持続型教育学（CSP）は、学生の文化的実践と言語を積極的に維持し活性化することで、文化的に適切な教育学を拡張します。単に学生の文化とのつながりを作るのではなく、CSPはこれらの文化を世代を超えて維持されるべき資産として位置づけます。言語的、リテラシー的、文化的多元主義を社会的目標として支持します。
key_principles: Cultural practices as assets to sustain
Support for heritage languages and literacies
Youth cultural practices valued and developed
Pluralism as educational and societal goal
Dynamic rather than static view of culture

theories.name: Decolonizing Education
theories.description: Decolonizing Education challenges the colonial foundations of educational systems and knowledge production. It centers Indigenous knowledge, questions Western epistemological dominance, and seeks to transform curricula and institutions shaped by colonial histories. The approach recognizes education as a site of both colonial violence and potential liberation.
theories.description_ja: 脱植民地化教育は、教育システムと知識生産の植民地的基盤に挑戦します。先住民の知識を中心に据え、西洋認識論的支配に疑問を呈し、植民地の歴史によって形作られたカリキュラムと制度の変革を目指します。このアプローチは、教育を植民地的暴力と潜在的解放の両方の場として認識します。
limitations: Ongoing process with no clear endpoint

theories.name: Ubuntu Pedagogy
theories.description: Ubuntu Pedagogy is rooted in the African philosophy of Ubuntu, meaning 'I am because we are.' It emphasizes collective humanity, interdependence, and community-centered education. Learning is understood as a communal process where individual development serves the collective good. Ubuntu challenges Western individualism in education with a relational, humanistic approach.
theories.description_ja: ウブントゥ教育学は、「私があるのは私たちがあるから」を意味するアフリカの哲学ウブントゥに根ざしています。集団的人間性、相互依存、コミュニティ中心の教育を強調します。学習は、個人の発達が集団の利益に奉仕する共同プロセスとして理解されます。ウブントゥは関係的で人間主義的なアプローチで教育における西洋的個人主義に挑戦します。
key_principles: I am because we are - collective humanity
Education serves community, not just individual
limitations: May conflict with competitive educational systems

theories.name: Indigenous Education
theories.description: Indigenous Education encompasses educational practices, philosophies, and systems developed by Indigenous peoples that center Indigenous knowledge, languages, and ways of being. It emphasizes place-based learning, oral traditions, community involvement, and holistic development. Indigenous education challenges dominant educational paradigms while working to revitalize and sustain Indigenous cultures.
theories.description_ja: 先住民教育は、先住民の知識、言語、存在様式を中心に据える、先住民によって発展された教育実践、哲学、システムを包括します。場所に基づく学習、口承伝統、コミュニティの関与、全人的発達を強調します。先住民教育は、支配的な教育パラダイムに挑戦しながら、先住民文化の活性化と持続に取り組みます。
key_principles: Indigenous knowledge systems as valid and valuable
Holistic development: spiritual, physical, mental, emotional
applications: Cultural camps and traditional knowledge programs

theories.name: Bilingual Education Theory
theories.name_ja: バイリンガル教育理論
theories.description: Bilingual Education Theory addresses how students can develop proficiency in two or more languages while achieving academic success. Key concepts include Cummins' BICS/CALP distinction, interdependence hypothesis, and threshold theory. Modern translanguaging approaches recognize bilingualism as a resource rather than a problem, supporting flexible use of multiple languages for learning.
theories.description_ja: バイリンガル教育理論は、学生が学業上の成功を達成しながら、2つ以上の言語の習熟度を発達させる方法を扱います。主要な概念にはカミンズのBICS/CALPの区別、相互依存仮説、閾値理論が含まれます。現代のトランスランゲージングアプローチは、バイリンガリズムを問題ではなくリソースとして認識し、学習のための複数言語の柔軟な使用を支援します。
key_principles: BICS vs CALP: social language vs academic language
Linguistic interdependence: L1 supports L2 development
Threshold hypothesis: bilingual advantages require proficiency
Translanguaging: flexible use of linguistic repertoire

theories.name: Herbartian Pedagogy
theories.description: Herbartian Pedagogy, developed by Johann Friedrich Herbart, established education as a systematic science with clear methodology. The famous 'five formal steps' (preparation, presentation, association, generalization, application) structured lesson planning and influenced teacher education worldwide. Herbart emphasized building on prior knowledge and developing moral character through instruction.
theories.description_ja: ヘルバルト教育学は、ヨハン・フリードリヒ・ヘルバルトによって発展され、明確な方法論を持つ体系的な科学として教育を確立しました。有名な「五段階教授法」（予備、提示、比較、総合、応用）は授業計画を構造化し、世界中の教師教育に影響を与えました。ヘルバルトは既存の知識に基づく学習と、教授を通じた道徳的品性の発達を強調しました。
limitations: Can become overly rigid and formulaic
May not accommodate diverse learning styles

theories.name: Summerhill Education
theories.description: Summerhill Education, founded by A.S. Neill in 1921, represents a radical approach to democratic schooling. Students have complete freedom to attend or skip classes, and school decisions are made democratically by staff and students with equal votes. The philosophy holds that children naturally want to learn when free from coercion, and emotional well-being is prioritized over academic achievement.
theories.description_ja: サマーヒル教育は、1921年にA.S.ニイルによって設立され、民主的な学校運営への急進的なアプローチを代表します。生徒は授業に出席するか欠席するかの完全な自由を持ち、学校の決定は職員と生徒が平等な投票権を持つ民主的な方法で行われます。この哲学は、子どもたちは強制から解放されると自然に学びたくなり、学業成績よりも情緒的な幸福が優先されるという立場をとります。
key_principles: Freedom to attend or skip classes
limitations: May not prepare for structured environments

theories.name: Jenaplan Education
theories.description: Jenaplan Education, developed by Peter Petersen in 1920s Germany and widely adopted in the Netherlands, organizes schools around multi-age family groups rather than grade levels. Learning occurs through a rhythmic alternation of conversation, play, work, and celebration. Students learn at their own pace while developing responsibility and community through mixed-age interaction.
theories.description_ja: イエナプラン教育は、1920年代にドイツのペーター・ペーターゼンによって発展され、オランダで広く採用され、学年ではなく異年齢のファミリーグループを中心に学校を組織します。学習は対話、遊び、仕事、祝典のリズミカルな交替を通じて行われます。学生は異年齢の相互作用を通じて責任感とコミュニティを発達させながら、自分のペースで学びます。
key_principles: Four basic activities: dialogue, play, work, celebration
strengths: Develops social skills through mixed ages
limitations: May not fit standardized testing systems

theories.name: Holistic Education
theories.description: Holistic Education addresses the whole person—intellectual, emotional, social, physical, creative, and spiritual dimensions. It recognizes the interconnectedness of all aspects of learning and life, emphasizing relationships, meaning-making, and connection to the broader world. Learning is understood as a transformative process that develops the full human potential.
theories.description_ja: ホリスティック教育は、知的、情緒的、社会的、身体的、創造的、精神的な次元を含む全人を対象とします。学習と生活のすべての側面の相互連結性を認識し、関係性、意味構築、より広い世界とのつながりを強調します。学習は人間の潜在能力を完全に発達させる変容的なプロセスとして理解されます。

theories.name: Democratic Education
theories.description: Democratic Education involves students in decisions about their own learning and the governance of their educational communities. It extends beyond teaching about democracy to practicing democratic principles through student voice, shared decision-making, and respect for individual rights. Schools become laboratories for democratic citizenship and self-directed learning.
theories.description_ja: 民主的教育は、学生を自らの学習と教育コミュニティの運営に関する決定に参加させます。民主主義について教えることを超えて、学生の声、共同意思決定、個人の権利の尊重を通じて民主的原則を実践します。学校は民主的市民権と自己主導的学習のための実験室となります。
key_principles: Respect for individual rights and autonomy
limitations: Some students may struggle with freedom

theories.name: Forest Kindergarten
theories.description: Forest Kindergarten (Waldkindergarten/Forest School) is an outdoor education approach where children spend most of their time learning in natural environments. Originating in Denmark and popular in Germany and Scandinavia, it emphasizes direct experience with nature, child-initiated play, and risk-taking within safe boundaries. Children develop resilience, creativity, and environmental awareness through nature-based learning.
theories.description_ja: 森のようちえん（ヴァルトキンダーガルテン/フォレストスクール）は、子どもたちが自然環境の中でほとんどの時間を学習に費やす屋外教育アプローチです。デンマークで発祥し、ドイツやスカンジナビアで人気があり、自然との直接体験、子どもが主導する遊び、安全な境界内でのリスクテイクを強調します。子どもたちは自然に基づく学習を通じて、レジリエンス、創造性、環境意識を発達させます。
key_principles: Regular and repeated exposure to natural environments
limitations: May not fit all regulatory frameworks

theories.name: Sensory Integration Theory
theories.description: Sensory Integration Theory, developed by occupational therapist A. Jean Ayres, explains how the brain organizes and processes sensory information for adaptive behavior. When sensory processing is disrupted, learning and behavior can be affected. The theory guides therapeutic interventions that provide organized sensory experiences to improve neurological processing and support children with sensory processing challenges.
theories.description_ja: 感覚統合理論は、作業療法士のA.ジーン・エアーズによって発展され、脳が適応行動のために感覚情報をいかに組織化し処理するかを説明します。感覚処理が乱されると、学習と行動に影響を与える可能性があります。この理論は、神経学的処理を改善し、感覚処理に課題を持つ子どもを支援するために、組織化された感覚体験を提供する治療的介入を導きます。
key_principles: Brain organizes sensory input for adaptive response
Seven sensory systems (including vestibular and proprioceptive)
Sensory processing affects learning and behavior
